_header: All that beth of heart true / A stound harkeneth to my song
_description: An Elegy on the Death of Edward I — in 8-line stanzas

CULAdd4407a.First Lines:
…of qwom þat god haued don is willeMe þonketh
                    þat deþe haue done vs wrongÞat he so sone schal liggen
                    stilleEngelond þou aghtes wel to knowe…
CULAdd4407a.Last Lines:
…þou ȝeue hys soule mechil onurAnd brink yt into
                    heuene blis
CULAdd4407a.Note:
Fragments a (lines 6-12), b (lines 20-29), c (lines 83-8 with 4 new
                    lines).
CULAdd4407a.Editions:
Skeat,  Walter William. 
             “‘Elegy on the Death of King Edward I’ from a New
                MS.” 
             Modern Language Review
         7 (1912): 149-52: 149.

BLHar2253.First Lines:
Alle þat beoþ of huerte trewea stounde herkneþ to my
                    song…
BLHar2253.Last Lines:
…bidde we god ant oure ledyto þilke blisse iesus vs
                    sende
BLHar2253.Note: 91 lines; written two lines of verse per line in the MS.
